data.title: Test: hide the activity bar
data.body:
- [x] Windows -  @ramya-rao-a
- [x] macOS -  @isidorn 
- [x] Linux -  @Tyriar 

Complexity: 1

A new setting `workbench.activityBar.visible` allows to control the visibility of the activity bar. 

Verify:
* this setting works as expected
* you can toggle visibility from the View menu
* you can toggle visibility from the command palette

data.title: Test: Electron Update 1.4.x
data.body:
- [x] Windows - @mousetraps
- [x] OS X -  @mjbvz
- [x] Linux - @roblourens

Complexity: 4

We have updated Electron to version 1.4.x and thereby jumped 1 chrome releases. This test item asks for exploratory testing focusing on native integration where possible:
- drag and drop
- menus and context menus
- window management and multiple windows
- UI regressions
- accessibility regressions

**Windows**: we no longer need the `cat.exe` workaround to see output when running Code from the command line. Verify you can interact with our CLI and see output properly.

data.title: Test: new setting to remove tab close buttons
data.body:
- [x] anyOS - @joaomoreno 
- [x] anyOS - @sandy081 

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/10739

Complexity: 1

We added a new setting `workbench.editor.showTabCloseButton` that allows to hide the close button on tabs. 

Verify
* when hiding you still see dirty indicators but you cannot close the tab anymore by left click to that area

data.title: Test: Support arguments when defining keybindings
data.body:
- [x] anyOS - @rebornix 
- [x] anyOS - @jrieken 

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14854

Complexity: 1

We enabled commands to accept arguments when defined in `keybindings.json`. Therefor there is a new args value that can be set per keybinding. For example:

`{ "key": "enter", "command": "type", "args": { "text": "Hello World"}, "when": "editorTextFocus" }
`

Should add "Hello World" to the editor whenever you press enter. 

Verify quickly this works OK.

data.title: Test: new option to show full path in window title
data.body:
- [x] Linux (Ubuntu) - @chrisdias 
- [x] OSX - @chrisdias
- [x] anyOS - @seanmcbreen 

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3119

Complexity: 1

There is a new setting `window.showFullPath` that once enabled will show the full path to the currently opened file instead of the workspace relative path.

Verify this works as expected for:
* folder opened in VS Code
* no folder opened in VS Code

data.title: Test: new option to insert final new line
data.body:
- [x] anyOS - @mjbvz 
- [x] anyOS - @jrieken 

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1666

Complexity: 1

There is a new setting `files.insertFinalNewline` that can be enabled to adding a final empty new line at the end of files.

Verify this feature works as expected.

data.title: Test: custom window title (Mac)
data.body:
- [ ] macOS - @mjbvz 
- [x] macOS - @roblourens 

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15098

Complexity: 3

On Mac OS we are no longer drawing the native window title but our own. Verify:
* you can configure this behaviour via `window.titleBarStyle` after a restart
* the title updates when switching between editors or closing them
* the title picks the theme color (dark, light, hc)
* the title hides when entering fullscreen and comes back when leaving
* a context menu on the title allows to see the path hierarchy and open specific segments
* widgets like quick open, debug toolbar and messages show below the title when it is visible and to the top when the title is not visible (e.g. fullscreen)
* widgets that are visible adjust their position when the visibility of the custom title changes

data.title: [Feature Request] Debugger - add restart option to request:"launch"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: OSX

When debugging with request:"attach" there is "restart":true/false option, which is very useful when launching "child_process restarting on file change solution". But still have to start app in console, or vscode command, and kill it manually. It will be very nice to have only one button to start/stop app with debugger. This can be done via request:"launch" and port:{my_custom_child_process_debugger_port}, but when child_process restarts, debugger is detached and need to be re-attached same way like "restart":true option when request:"attach".

Thank you very much

data.title: Opening links ability from integrated terminal
data.body: In many popular terminals (for example iTerm2) I can press "cmd+click" for open link in default system browser.

data.title: Create file and nested directories at once
data.body:
It would be great, if you could create number of nested directories specifying their names separated with slashes in the dialog that opens while creating new file.

For example if you create file entering following string into dialog: `/app/some/module/api.ts`
It should create folder structure like this:
```
app/
  some/
    module/
      api.ts
```

If `some` folder  already exists, it should just create subfolder `module` into it and put `api.ts` file into it.

data.title: Long delay when previewing Markdown files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 build 14393.447

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a markdown files with approx. 30 lines of text.
2. Press ctrl+shift+v to preview the file

There is a very noticable delay before the preview is shown (~3 seconds). Of course this is not a huge issue, but this delay has not always been there (it was introduced, going from memory, around VS Code version 1.5 or 1.6), which leads me to believe it's a bug rather than an inevitable consequence of the parsing process.

data.title: Reference counted (workbench) text models
data.body:
@bpasero @jrieken 

The idea here is what we have discussed: make [`ITextModelResolverService`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/15797/files#diff-df9addfcedde446af898cebb60c97b18R16) the one-stop-shop for retrieving (workbench) text editor models, given a `URI`. [The `resolve` method was renamed to a `getModelReference()`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/15797/files#diff-df9addfcedde446af898cebb60c97b18R23) which returns a reference to a model. The contract is to `dispose()` that reference once the caller doesn't need the model any more.

This PR adopts that interface and [implements it for the contributable content provider models](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/15797/files#diff-c0f58b9681f8ffe04ae282621f605dd6R125). The other two types ([`file:`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/15797/files#diff-c0f58b9681f8ffe04ae282621f605dd6R114) and [`untitled:`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/15797/files#diff-c0f58b9681f8ffe04ae282621f605dd6R120)) are wrapped around `ImmortalReferences`, which means they will _live_ on forever, just like they have so far, until someone calls `dispose()` on the model itself. This needs adoption in the future. The PR further fulfils the reference contract by calling `dispose()` when the models are no longer needed. @jrieken this is mostly your area.

The big goal is to allow proper disposal of text editor models without resorting to ugly methods such as looping through all the open editors. This first step already lets me implement my dirty diff contribution while doing proper model cleanup.

data.title: Support objects when sending output to debug console
data.body:
The Output event now supports individual objects being passed.

Ideally show these in the debug console like this:

![2016-11-18_11-30-17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/20479333/1571d26c-afde-11e6-8dcc-75ab0744b262.png)

or in case side-by-side trees are not possible:

![2016-11-18_16-24-48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/20479342/1dcceb2c-afde-11e6-8feb-5dc841c64af4.png)

Consider to use the first approach when only a single object is passed. 

The corresponding debug protocol addition is https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/79

data.title: Allow markdown preview to scroll past content
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a markdown document
2. Open the markdown preview
3. Try and scroll past the content in the markdown preview.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/677704/20479337/18fa7b64-afde-11e6-927c-708cadddc5a8.png)

The changes required to implement this are probably a small subset of what is required to implement #5047, but I'm hoping this can be done easily and released soon, whereas #5047 may require significantly more work. If #5047 is implemented in the meantime then I expect it can supersede this issue.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: 1.7.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create "file in use"
2. Delete that file via VS Code
3. Refresh the explorer

My case: I have selenium standalone server and web drivers. My selenium server is running and drivers are in use, so they cannot be removed. However if I attempt to remove such a file via VS Code, it will be successfully deleted from explorer without any warning. After I refresh the VS Code explorer, "removed" file is still present.

It would be best if I can define what is the current file type, so that I don't need to change the file type to fulfill the condition of those plugin/syntax highlight.

data.title: [Linux] EACCES on temporary socket with custom temp dir
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1-1478180561
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1
- Custom temp dir for the user is defined: `cat /etc/environment`: `TMP=~/.tmp`

Steps to reproduce: try starting code, e.g. from terminal: `/usr/share/code/code`, getting:
```
Error: listen EACCES ~/.tmp/Code-eaa8ce-1.7.1.sock
    at Object.exports._errnoException (util.js:1026:11)
    at exports._exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:1049:20)
    at Server._listen2 (net.js:1240:19)
    at listen (net.js:1289:10)
    at Server.listen (net.js:1378:5)
    at /usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:6:31339
    at new n.Class.derive._oncancel (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:6:5711)
    at Object.c [as serve] (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:6:31269)
    at i (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:11:19705)
    at q (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:11:20776)
```

If I redefine TMP dir, e.g. `export TMP=/tmp`, code starts.

The per-user TMP dir has the following permissions:
`drwx------ 34 userX userX 4,0K nov 21 04:08 /home/userX/.tmp/`

Changing its mode and the mode of the user's home dir to 777 doesn't help.

data.title: Can I set the app's user language to English while system Language is Chinese?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions:

I am an iOS developer in China now, while I used to be a .Net developer using C#. I am familiar with the English Menu and some other setting items in Xcode and other tools on Mac OS X, since most of the software on Mac OS X does not support Chinese. 

Now i found VSCode can NOT set the app's menu language as English while my Mac OS X is Chinese Language. the app's language is the same with the OS language

The good side of using English is that,  there is no ambiguity for every menu item.  Now, even when some menu item are in Chinese(my mother tongue), I am confused with its meaning. 

So, would you please give us an option to set the app's runtime language?

data.title: Allow editing the git index

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Using vim with the [fugitive](https://github.com/tpope/vim-fugitive) plugin, I can edit the index in the diff-view directly, instead of it being readonly. I would like to see this feature in VSCode as well!

This is really useful for making partial commits. If I do more than one change at the time, sometimes it is impossible to split these changes into distinct commits with just the current feature of being able to stage selected lines.

Let me give you an example:

Before the changes:
```cs
functionCall(argument);
```

After both changes:
```cs
functionCall(argument, changeA, changeB);
```

Although change A and change B can be independent from each other, you cannot do separate commits easily. If I could edit the index directly however, I could do this:
```cs
functionCall(argument, changeA);
```
Then commit change A and only after that commit change B as well.

data.title: Multiple workspaces not restored : OSX
data.body:

2. Reboot Mac

A maximum of ONE workspace is restored.
